Easily one of Valve's finest past Half-life, Portal 2 breathes new life on the PC edition thanks to its many sub-games made by the community, such as Portal Stories: Mel and Portal Tag, each with their own stories and amazing ways to play.

As for the game itself, it's essentially a must-play to anyone new with Valve's games, between it's quirky voice lines, mind-stimulating puzzles, and expansive story into the heart of Aperture science. 

A wonderful game that had introduced me to Valve as a company, Portal 2 will always have a special place to me.

so i just replayed both portal 1 and 2 and i have to say they both hold up. you can tell more work went into portal 2. portal 1 was good but defiantly a proof of concept (not to be confused with a hello world that would lack meaningful content). portal 2 seams much more fleshed out. there is allot more narrative and allot more puzzles. the jokes come quicker and cave Johnson and wheatly were great additions to the cast. the puzzles were more varied and they introduced new elements. tons of fun. if you haven't played ether game go do it now. it would take you less time to play the first game then to read all the reviews. do yourself a favor.
